application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details required for Condition 3 (Samples), 4 (Design), 9 (Boundary Treatment), 10 (Construction Management Plan), 11 (Levels), 13 (Landscaping), 18 (Climate Change Mitigation) and 19 (Sustainable Drainage) of planning permission 20/00625/FUL (Erection of five bedroom dwelling)
decision_conditions: Insufficient cogent detail has been provided in regard to Condition 3 (Samples) of how bricks are to be laid with different finishes. As such, the applicant has failed to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012..Before condition 3 (Samples) can be discharged, a sample panel should be made up on site to demonstrate the appearance of the proposal and photographs, alongside samples of other bricks (Hammersmith London Stock Brick, Imperial Soft Red Brick) need to be provided so that a decision can be made regarding whether the proposed materials are acceptable.

Insufficient cogent detail has been provided in regard to Condition 4 (Architectural Details). Information for windows, doors, overhangs, rainwater goods are required at scale 1:10. As such, the applicant has failed to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Before condition 4 (Architectural Details), can be discharged the proposed dentil mouldings to be used externally should be specified. Also details of the proposed entrance portico along with details of rainwater goods, apart from the eaves gutter need to be provided
